evidence.text: NOTICE of Hearing: Motion Hearing set for 12/16/2024 at 10:00 AM in Winston-Salem Courtroom #2 before JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER. (ae) (Entered: 11/25/2024)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER in WS-2: Motion Hearing held on 12/16/2024 on 2 Joint MOTION for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree filed by UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. AUSA Rebecca Mayer and DOJ Trial Attorneys Emily Given and Robert Rich present for the Government. Attorney Ann Marie Tosco present for the City of Durham. Argument presented. Supplemental briefing to address the application, or not, of Ricci and if Ricci does apply, why there is a strong basis in evidence due within 30 days. Matter taken under advisement. (Court Reporter Briana Chesnut.) (ae)

add_extracted.value: Motion Hearing held on 12/16/2024 at 10:00 AM in Winston-Salem Courtroom #2 before JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER regarding Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree

evidence.text: Within fifteen (15) days after the execution of this Decree, the Parties shall file a Joint Motion for the Provisional Approval and Entry of the Decree by the Court and request a Fairness Hearing on the Terms of this Consent Decree to allow the Court to determine whether the terms of the Decree are fair, adequate, reasonable, lawful, and not a product of collusion or against the public interest. The Parties will request that the Court provide notice at least one hundred thirty (130) days before the date and time set for a Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree.

add_extracted.value: Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree scheduled with at least 130 days notice for Court to determine fairness, adequacy, and reasonableness of the Consent Decree

evidence.text: Upon filing the Proposed Individual Relief Awards List, the United States shall simultaneously move the Court to hold a Fairness Hearing on Individual Relief to allow the Court to determine whether the Proposed Individual Relief Awards List should be approved or amended. The Court will provide the Parties with at least one hundred and twenty (120) days' notice of the date and time set for the Fairness Hearing on Individual Relief.

add_extracted.value: Fairness Hearing on Individual Relief scheduled with at least 120 days notice for Court to determine approval of Individual Relief Awards List

event.doc_name: Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree

evidence.text: Plaintiff United States of America hereby dismisses the above-captioned case pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 41(a)(1). The United States has determined not to proceed further in this matter.

the City of Durham has not served the United States with either an answer or a motion for summary judgment. The United States therefore has the right to voluntarily dismiss this case without a court order, and it hereby does so.
the Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree is scheduled to be held on ________________, 2025

args.reason: All checklist items (Trials) are correctly marked as Not Applicable with sufficient evidence from Notice of Voluntary Dismissal (dismissal without trial) and Order (Fairness Hearing as consent decree procedural step, not trial). All documents fully visited.

All documents fully visited with conclusive evidence of voluntary dismissal (Notice of Voluntary Dismissal) and consent decree procedural steps (Joint Motion, Order) confirming no trial occurred. Trials marked 'Not Applicable' with three evidence sources per checklist requirements.
